Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Rooftop Gareden, Even in Winter”
Reviews.Author: Lorrence
Reviews.Content: The Raphael is a wonderful hotel! The service is outstanding, the staff friendly, helpful and courteous. The Metro has a stop immediately in front of the hotel so that you can easily get around. Or use a cab--there is a cab stand right there, too (and an ATM close by). With the subway, you are close to everything--the museums, shopping, the opera, even Versailles by train. But even more exciting is the roof garden where you can watch the nightime displays from the Eiffel Tower (wonderful picture taking) or watch the activity around the Arc de Triomphe which is only a couple of blocks away. And the rates are very reasonable. It was a wonderful experience for my wife, my daughter and granddaughter, as well as myself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: OutsideTheBeltway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Raphael during an anniversary visit to Paris. We were upgraded to a very large and comfortable junior suite. Other reviews have mentioned how the hotel is well located. Our main impression, however, was of outstanding service. The staff and management could not have been more courteous and helpful. Room service, the desk, and the porters anticipated every need. The concierge made excellent suggestions for a variety of restaurants. Perfect. On a minor note, I found it reassuring while descending the stairwell to see the brass bannister rail polished daily and the wrought iron being dusted with a feather duster.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the Right Bank”
Reviews.Author: ANSH90210
Reviews.Content: The Raphael, on Avenue Kleber, provided us with lovely belle-epoque room, huge in size with bedroom offset in an alcove and separate closet/dressing room. If you like the Right Bank, they have packages including breakfast, wifi etc which are a "deal" for the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Twinponds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful with lovely rooms and glorious rooftop views. We have stayed there four times in the last five years and would not think of staying anywhere else. In fact, we are returning again this summer. The staff are helpful and friendly. There is great access to the city and a metro stop outside the door. Just not a bad thing to say! Request a room with balcny for an extra special experience.

Reviews.Title: “the charming Hotel Raphael”
Reviews.Author: Hamed1980
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife visited this beautiful and cozy, luxurious hotel in October for 3 nights. We booked through LHW.COM. When we checked in we were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was really lovely and spacious. Lovely bathroom with natural light coming in, huge living room, spacious "bedroom" with comfortable bed (like all the LHW) and a great walking closet. Huge windows that we could open with a "french balkony". The wireless internet in the room worked perfectly and was very fast. Room service was fast. I had got a cold and ordered tea and lemon and honey in the middle of the night and they brought it very quickly to the room without any charge. When we checked in I told them that it was my wifes bithday. Little later when we were in the room they came with little sweet cake that had a note written on it; Happy Bithday. That was thoughtful of them. We liked almost everything about this place. One thing we did not like was that most workers in the dining (breakfast) room did not speak english + that the service was not so good. They did not take our questions seriously either. Improvements needed. Location is perfect. Walk one minute and you are on champs elysees. 30-45 min walk to Eiffel Tower. Ist little expensive but if you want a good place in Paris it will cost you. If you want a perfect location and a lot of space in the room then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “An experience I will repeat soon”
Reviews.Author: Rahayel
Reviews.Content: The "Hotel Raphael", a legend and a name, is one of the oldest hotels of Paris, located in the heart of the capital, at a walking distance from the "Arc de Triomphe" and the famous "Champs Elysees". Entering Hotel Raphael one discovers the atmosphere of a private club. Walnut paneling and generous seating areas line the wide gallery, hung with art and carpeted with Oriental rugs. Rococo describes the ambience of the high-ceilinged guest rooms, furnished with Regency, Louis XV, Louis XVI, Empire, and Directoire antiques, yet thoughtfully appointed with satellite television, direct-dial telephone with voice mail and modem port. The Raphael is a unique Parisian hotel, more of a club. Whether you are in the intimate atmosphere of the "Bar Anglais", in one of the cosseted suites or in one of the vast bedrooms, you will be made to feel at home, with attentive personnel to fulfil your every need. I visit Paris on average, once per month. This is the first time that i choose an Hotel that is not part of an international chain, and believe me it was worth it. The service, the welcoming, the location, the food, the free valet parking, the room service, dinner in the room, the 30sqm room space, the huge bathroom size, the room lighting, the english bar are few of the services we tried and that are simply perfect. The price might be a bit high but very adequate to what you get. We didn't have the chance to experience the rooftop terrace, but will surely do next summer.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: mccaw737
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic 3 nite stay at this great hotel. Location is outstanding for sightseeing, metro stop at your doorstep. The hotel is very well maintained, the dining room is beautiful and breakfast superior. The help is very professional and friendly. Hotel has a quiet sophisticated feeling about it without being snobby, I would highly recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “One night at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: seld0on
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris with my girlfriend for a nice weekend. We stayed at a friends place, but i also wanted to treat my girlfriend to a night in a fancy hotel. Having searched on location, price and reviews on trip advisor, I decided to book a room at the Hotel Raphael. I chose the Deluxe room, and was excited to go. There was a nice confirmation email mentioning that I could make free use of the fitness room, which prompted me to bring my work out clothes :) Excited to check in, we go to the hotel on Saturday afternoon and were kindly greeted. The staff was friendly and the hotel lobby and dressing looked fantastic. Really nice, old-fashioned, lots of wood. You have to like it, but if you do its great! We got to the room on the first floor and it looked stately, just like the pictures. I went to check out the fitness room and after I had found it, it turned out to be an upgraded cupboard (ok, they did have a shower separate to the work out area.) All they had was a treadmill, a bike, a cross-trainer and some dumbels. That to me was the first disappointment. Since the treadmill was already taken, I went back to the room and checked out the bathroom. Everything looked okay, but on closer inspection it turned out that: The shower cabin looked a bit moldy at the rubbers and the doors didnt close properly. Overall, it all looked quite dated, as in that it hadnt been serviced for a long time. The toilet seat also looked damaged, which to me really takes away from their luxury branding. A shame really because you expect quality. After having gone out for a nice meal, we came back and got ready for bed. That's when we noticed that the rooms were super noisy. Our bathroom had a locked door, that was connected to another room. So if you spoke in the bathroom, the other guests could hear it. When we layed in bed, we could hear the television set of another room adjacent to our room. All these small things are to me missed opportunities for a four star hotel. Thats why we were disappointed. deluxe room fitness room

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jfm57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice central location. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel was old but nicely kept as we were expecting. Our room was a corner room next to a building that was being built. That was not something that was a problem. The room was huge much to our delight although the antique furniture was uncomfortable. The first day the maid came for turn down services at 4 in the afternoon. We had just gotten back from walking around and were resting so I asked her to come back but she never did. Not the end of the world.the windows were wide open when we arrived and we kept them like that as it was a nice day however, when we closed up at night there was an overwhelming smell of some sort of solvent. I literally couldn't sleep for a while. The next day we aired the room during the day but the same thing happened at night. I felt I was being asphiciated. I mentioned this when we checked out and hope they were able to do something. I have a feeling this was not the first time there was a complaint about that. In any event, overall, it was ok but a bit stuffy and I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb historic hotel, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Phudpucker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a 3-week European tour (5 countries) and I decided to splash on a "special" hotel in Paris for a couple of nights so we could experience the best the city has to offer. After consulting numerous Tripadvisor reviews, I settled on Hotel Raphael - which subsequently met all our expectations and more. Upon arrival, our first impressions were "Wow!" - the hotel is a wonderfully historic building with masses of antique furnishings and classic renaissance decor. The desk clerk happily informed us that we'd been upgraded to a junior suite - although I was never able to conclude what may have prompted that to occur. Never look a gift horse in the mouth! He then personally escorted us to our "room" - a word that does no justice to what we entered. The suite was undoubtedly the most sumptuous and elegant accommodations my wife and I have ever encountered - and we've traveled extensively over the years with little concern about budget. If you've ever wondered about whether the photos shown on hotels' websites are an accurate representation of what you'll get, this is one case where they actually did. The hotel is within 100 yards of the Arc De Triumphe, so it's brilliantly located for all the usual attractions. Service and attentiveness were first class, as one should expect in something this "high end". The restaurant was excellent - albeit possibly a little "formal" for our liking, but we acknowledge that Europeans have a different perspective on this, which we respect and enjoy. However, there are plenty of options within walking distance - so we didn't feel in any way confined. If money were literally no object, the Raphael is a magical experience in the most wonderfully romantic sense. I can't comment on what the "normal" rooms might be like, but the suite was a truly memorable highlight of our European vacation. Maybe they mistook us for Brad and Angelina, but we gratefully accepted the upgrade. Cost? - very expensive. Enjoyment? - priceless. I've rated it Very Good only because of the cost factor - you really need to be prepared to drop some serious Euros. As for the rest of the experience, it was definitely an Excellent in every way.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely old-fashioned time!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaDavies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raphael in Paris in October 2011 on a beautiful weekend in Paris. Even before we arrived, I was very impressed by the incredibly helpful concierge desk, who (due to my changing my mind about restaurants) changed my bookings three times without a single complaint and managed to secure a last minute reservation at Les ambassadeurs at the Hotel Crillon (no mean feat!) From the moment you walk in and climb into the old-fashioned lift with it's cage door, it's like stepping back into the victorian era, but with modern bits. Our suite was lovely, a huge bathroom and a bedroom in a curtained alcove with a large living room with lovely antique furniture. A fruit bowl and chocolates were a nice touch. The breakfast buffet was really good with yummy extra additions if you wanted. It's also right by 2 major metro stations, so easy to get around. The staff couldn't have been more helpful for the entire stay. My only niggles were that you had to pay for wi-fi (not what i expect at E400 plus a night) and that the prices in the downstairs bar (which is lovely) were extortionate - E25 for a cocktail, E20 for a glass of champagne and E8 for a soft drink. It was cheaper to drink at the hotel Crillon (which we duly did). The mini-bar was not much better! All in all though, we had a delighful stay and would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret”
Reviews.Author: mcristo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times since was recommended by a French friend. Its old like every other hotel in Paris but it has style and the service is great. The location is good and the breakfast likewise Only bad thing is the cost for internet but reckon its like that all over Paris

Reviews.Title: “Romance and style”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Lady_Traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful rooms I have stayed in and a wonderful location! The service was extremely friendly and quick, and the rooftop bar provides one of the best views of the Parisian skyline available. It's location is ideal as it is right in the heart of the Champs Elysee without having the noise and traffic of staying on the famous blvd. Beautiful fruit and chocolate on arrival and delicious champagne was brought up also. All-in-all, highly recommended for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the staff”
Reviews.Author: afser66
Reviews.Content: I visited the Raphael with two friends and we shared a junior suite. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. I have also stayed at two of the sister properties - the Majestic, located just behind the Raphael, and the Regina Hotel, across the street from the Louvre. Any one of the these properties works well for me. Each one has its own personality, but the people are all well trained and the Raphael and Regina are very close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Grammatical error”
Reviews.Author: FoodEpicure
Reviews.Content: Obivously, in my review below, I meant "great" restaurant, not "quail" restaurant -- my helpful Apple device got a little too exuberant with its word choices. Not a whole lot of restaurants in Paris or anywhere else dedicated completely to quail. Thanks for the positive comments about the review, FoodEpicure.

Reviews.Title: “Old world Paris in a Nutshell”
Reviews.Author: PeterHelsinki
Reviews.Content: For many years my wife and I have eyed this beautiful property on rue Kléber and in September this year we had the priviledge of spending three nights here. It is the sister propery of the Hotel Regina and the Majestic. Our welcome was warm and the staff a pleasure to deal with. The dining room was truly beautiful as all the other public areas such as the bar Anglais.The room was large and very comfortable. For those looking for a taste of the old Europe and Paris of a more gracious age, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Johnsotr
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Raphael in June 2011. We had an auction package through Luxury Link and expected a mediocre room. We were given a great 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms. It was large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is excellent and not to be missed. The only negative was that the noise from construction on an adjoining building awakened everyone in the hotel at 6:30 AM 6 days of the week. Once the construction is completed, the Raphael will be a well earned 4 stat hotel. The roof top restaurant with the view looking toward Etoile and Arc de Triomphe is excellent and very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate atmosphere near Champ Elise!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDermatology
Reviews.Content: Somehow the hotel lost his glorious days but a glamorous feeling is still there, at the bar, on the terrace which is spectacular and so green! The service is excellent and the petit-dejuner is really French with fresh, delicious croissants. But the first advantage of this hotel is that you can walk in the evening in one of the most beautiful aria of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: stancapper
Reviews.Content: We spent much more than we usually spend on a hotel, but we figured, "Hey, it's Paris, might as well splurge!" Great decision. Every member of the staff was friendly, helpful and exceedingly professional. The housekeeping staff seemed more professional than many front desk personnel we've encountered over the years. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. with a prior understanding that we could leave our luggage and explore until check-in time. However, the man at the check-in desk knew we were arriving (he asked our name before we got a chance to tell him) and he had a room ready for us. He escorted us there personally. After being up for 24 hours, this was such a welcome and much appreciated surprise. A plate of fresh fruit awaited us, and a little while later fresh flowers were delivered, and around 5:00 a bottle of champagne on ice was delivered. The room (junior suite) was spacious and beautiful, and the bed was outstanding. (Best European shower we've had by far!) Two days were in the mid-90s temp-wise, but the AC was great. Yes, there was construction right outside our balcony, but for some reason it did not bother us at all. It was actually kind of fun to watch them while my wife was getting ready each day. There was no drilling or banging, just the occasional sound of some humming machinery. The Metro is literally right outside the door! Head left on Kleber and you will soon find countless bistros, cafes, brasseries and patisseries. Head about half a mile that way and you come to Trocadero, the absolute best viewing site for the Tower. We'd watch it sparkle every night on the hour. Bottom line: You will pay a lot to stay here, but if it can be afforded, you will NOT be disappointed. Real elegance plus a professional, helpful staff that is eager to please, especially Monsieur Norbert, who made our arrival in Paris so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: laynabee
Reviews.Content: I purchased a package through luxurylink.com that included a junior suite, 3-course dinner with wine and breakfast. The bell staff were extremely helpful and friendly as were the employees at the front desk and concierge were efficient and gracious. The room was beautifully decorated. Dinner was excellent and the waitstaff were terrific (my friend is a picky eater and they allowed her to substitute a different dinner than one of the ones that were included in the set menu). The metro station is just a few steps away from the entrance to the hotel. The only drawback was that our balcony faced a building undergoing construction but the noise didn't bother us at all and we even got a little entertainment by watching the activity in the temporary office pod that had been erected!

Reviews.Title: “Charging for WiFi – not what one expects from a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Greatelk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raphael from the 14th June for 3 nights. The hotel itself and the rooms are beautifully finished. The high point is the concierge service which is really excellent. However, the hotel is not cheap and we were really surprised to find that the hotel charged by the hour for WiFi access. In this day and age it is not what one expects of a luxury hotel. It took from what would otherwise have been a pleasant stay. Even most motels nowadays provide free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant in some respects, but rather pricey.”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel5559
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful in a classic sense. If this is what you are looking for, than the Raphael is your place. If you are looking for something more modern, than this is not your place. For the price of this hotel, there is more left to be desired. Just a few words: --Wifi not included --Housekeeping staff was awesome--thank you! --Other staff seemed limited. Perhaps there are many more people working behind the scenes at the Raphael, but I only encountered about three or four staff members the entire stay. --Thin walls, allowing various sounds from other rooms to penetrate into your room (often including bathroom sounds)

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkvam
Reviews.Content: Very nice, old-school hotel in a great location right off of the Arch de Triomphe circle. Outstanding service and staff. Not inexpensive, but good value and high levels of personal service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to spend my birthday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine201
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raphael from May 11 to May 17th. I have to say it was an amazing stay. We had a junior suite. It was spacious with beautiful Louis XVI furniture. We were concerned about the noise from the construction but we were not disturbed by it at all! The concierge was wonderful. They were attentive, and made excellent reccomendations for restaurants. My boyfriend had contacted them a few times before we arrived and they had everything set up for us that he requested. We had dinner at the hotel the first night we were there and I was pleasantly suprised. The food was great and the service was excellent! Breakfast was included and they had everything you could want. The location was convenient, right by a Metro station. The upstairs bar was wonderful. It had amazing views. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: FoodEpicure
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Raphael, and quite a treat. Our alcove suite was quiet, elegant, with French doors opening onto Avenue Kleber, empire furniture everywhere, stained glass in the bathroom, and a shower with real gusto. The staff is unobtrusive and efficient, the concierge apparently friendly with every quail restaurant in Paris, and the Terrasse, the exquisite green oasis on the roof top, giving you unbelievable views of the nearby Arc de Triomphe, Tour Eiffel, and faraway Sacre Couer, that are not to be believed. Sit with a glass of champagne in this rose laden paradise, and you'll know the meaning of civilization. Give this gem a try.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, grand hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: mr610
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hotel Raphael - third visit in three years. It is a classic, palace hotel built to accomodate travelers who spent whole seasons in Paris. For this reason, the rooms and bathrooms are enormous. The decor is very old-world (lots of silk curtains, and dark velvet) so don't stay here if you're looking for a modern, minimalist design. The staff is incredibly friendly. The concierge team are very knowledgable and helpful- they were able to secure hard-to-get tickets for us about two weeks before our trip. Breakfast was included in our stay -pastries and a buffet that were very good. The bar is popular in the evenings for business people and locals. Expensive, yes, but you know that going into it. Worth noting - there is construction on both sides of the hotel right now and it looks like it will continue for a while. If possible, stay on a higher floor for better view/less noise. Overall a great stay with good location (metro stop on line 6 right outside the hotel, short distance to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs d'Elysees etc).

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: junnah
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday after 6 days at the hotel. My son kidded me that my catch phrase for the week was "value proposition" (he's a business degree candidate and I'm a doctor--I probably didn't do too well trying to speak his language). I would value the following elements to our stay: 1) The hotel is beautiful. It is not shiny and new, which is not high on my list of priorities. The bathrooms were clean and more than sufficient. The bed was very comfortable; my only trouble sleeping was either my screwed up internal clock or the kids upstairs playing tag until midnight-who calmed down instantly when we called the front desk for a little polite help. The rooms are unusually large for European hotels. 2) The location is superb. The Metro is literally 30 feet away and only one stop from a major exchange line (Etoile-Charles DeGaulle) from which you can get to all the major downtown sites in a matter of minutes. We walked to the Eiffel, Champs Elysees, the Four Seasons bar, the American Cathedral for Christmas service (not sure those two should be in that order, the bar and the church, but what the hey), and even the Rodin Museum and the Invalides, all in rainy/snowy weather, but we like to walk. If your expectation is more resort based where everything you might possibly need is moments away I'm not sure where you would stay in a grand city like Paris. This was easy at the Raphael. Go four blocks down Kleber and window gaze at the Teslas. 3) The food was very good. We also used the Luxury Link package and enjoyed the morning buffet. I left each day full and satisfied with what was available. Tempting to max out on the volume to reach the peak of the value proposition, but I'd hardly feel I had to order an extra omelette to get there. The dinner that was part of the package was very good. We stayed over Christmas and chose to also eat in on the holiday day since everything was closed. Both meals were very good; I would eat there again. Am I a heretic to admit that the value proposition at the hotel was better than at Guy Savoy (which I really enjoyed, just not so much the comma in the bill)?? 4) The alcove rooms (104,204,304....) are part of the package. We had no trouble whatsoever with construction noise but remember that we were there over the holiday. Given that I was paying half price, I don't think I would have complained about noise after, say 8 oclock in the morning, and we were gone for the rest of the day. Were I paying full price I would have asked for an upgrade and don't doubt for a moment that I would have been accomodated. 5) Service. Outstanding. Failingly polite. The better the question I asked, the better the help I got. Help them help you. Concierge was very quick to call and verify that something was open and that our reservations were intact. Thank God their English is so much better than my fractured French. I don't believe in being so tight with a buck that you can't enjoy yourself but can't imagine a feeling much worse than to have overspent on a vacation. I, like everyone else, work hard for my money. I feel good when I know someone has worked hard to separate me from my cash by giving me something good in return. Does it have to be over the top? Not any more; I'm over those days. Does it have to be just decent? No, it has to be much better than that. The Raphael nailed it.

Reviews.Title: “Raphael is a discreet gem of a classic Parisian luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: nemorino79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raphael for six nights during an unusually cold and wet week in early December 2010 and were totally charmed by the hotel's intimate and discreet atmosphere of sophisticated Parisian luxury. The hotel was built in the early 1900s apparently for well-heeled travellers who would stay for longer periods. Hall, restaurant and bar are plush but at the same time intimate and cozy. A sweet little fitness room was more recently added with a small steam room and sauna - perfect to warm up after a day of sightseeing and we always had it to ourselves. Our Alcove Room was huge by any standards and very classically appointed (hand painted ornamets on the walls, chandeliers, antique furniture and mirrors everywhere). The bed was most comfortable, plenty of wardrobe-space and a bathroom with daylight and a separate toilet. Very nice bathroom products by Fragonard. WiFi was available in the room and we paid 15,- Euros for 10 hours which was more than enough for our whole stay. The most impressive feature of Hotel Raphael was the incredible service: concierge was very efficient before and after arrival, maids made up our room (twice daily) even when we just left for half an hour and room-service for breakfast (inculing fresh rose) was out of this world so that we never got back to the breakfast downstairs. The standard breakfast is French (wonderful pastries, buttter, jams, freshly squeezed juice). The optional buffet is not huge but all the items (fresh fruits, ham, cheese, cereals etc.) are of the very best quality. Apparently, the hotel's breakfast is also quite popular with local businessmen immune to the steep prices. Had it not been included in our rate, I don't think I would have paid 39,- Euros for the buffet breakfast (certain egg-dishes then still come at an extra-charge). We had dinner once at the hotel as it was included in our package and the food was excellent. For Paris standards, the 65,- Euro dinner menu including drinks in such an elegant place is very good value. The location of the hotel is in a very upscale residential neighbourhood near Arc de Triomphe, not ideally located for sightseeing but a metro station is most conveniently located right in front of the hotel entrance. The hotel features an incredible rooftop-terrace with breathtaking views all over Paris (Arc de Triomphe - Sacre Coer - Eiffel tower). On the negative side I have to say that the fixtures in our room (wardrobe-doors, bathroom) were in need of maintenance and that the squeaking of the wooden floor of the room above us did slightly disturb our sleep but neither bothered us enough to report it to the front desk. Our "LuxuryLink" package included six nights accomodation in an Alcove Room, daily buffet breakfast and a dinner at the hotel's restaurant and represented outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Roldew
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel on a package offered through an online luxury hotel website and were extremely pleased with it! Our room was very spacious and the staff was wonderful and accommodating. Good location with a Metro stop just in front of the hotel, which was quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Most fabulous hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: greatescapist1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Raphael in mid-September. I had heard nothing but fantastic things about this hotel from several sources. I am a member of a luxury discount travel website and this hotel occasionally has packages for sale on that site. I purchased a 4 night package that included breakfast and some shopping discounts. We paid for a Boudoir (Deluxe room). My husband made a request to stay in a room with a view in the class that we had purchased because it was our anniversary. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to the Penthouse Suite and our the rest of our stay was beyond anything imagined. Our room had fantastic views of the Eiffel AND the Arc de Triomphe. I also wanted to bring to light in this review, the incredible service that the staff at this hotel provides. Every member of the staff was exceptionally polite and friendly. Even the housekeeping would greet you in the halls. The concierge is exceptionally helpful, and very fun to speak with. I found the negative reviews on this website about the decor to be very misleading. This hotel prides itself on maintaining antique furnishings throughout its rooms and does so with excellent taste. The bed was a brand new mattress and perfect for resting after a long day of Parisian fun. This is absolutely the perfect hotel in Paris. It's small and private, and only a block away from the Arc. The decorum is perfectly french and the service is world class. I will return to the Hotel Raphael soon, this all coming from some one who prides herself in never going to the same place twice.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and greedy”
Reviews.Author: champagnesweetie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raphael for one night as we wanted to stay in a grand Paris Hotel for the experience. We booked a Junior Suite- as nothing else was available- and they refused to include breakfast, or waive the fee for a roll a bed for our daughter in the high rate. Our room was hot and stuffy and was next to a building site! We called the reception for help who was initially reluctant - it was only when pushed that he sent a bellboy with a fan! We all had a bad night's sleep and were charged heavily for it. We were also charged for the "free" wifi. This hotel trades on its name, the decor is tired and basic things such as air conditioning don't function properly. Take my tip and go there for a drink or coffee at the downstairs bar instead.

Reviews.Title: “very nice... but too american”
Reviews.Author: port-au-persil
Reviews.Content: Grand hotel, but dated. Rooms are immense for Paris, but the deco is a little kitch. Service is excellent - we recommand but for older people. Bad thing... at 450 euros a night, no free internet! Definitely from anothe era!

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: ErnestoRojas
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the heart of paris and we could walk to the most attractive sites. the staff was very accommodating and warm and the restaurant was divine. I found this hotel on luxury group and booked directly. they had a special promotion at the time which made it really nice since my girlfriend wanted shopping advice the concierge was most helpful and also told us about the outlet shopping outside paris

Reviews.Title: “Raphael is THE place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: finisterre72
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, our luggage was immediately whisked away and we were checked in with great ease. Our junior suite was extremely spacious and the bathroom well supplied with toiletries etc. Breakfast was a delight (the fresh fruit and orange juice wonderful) with lots of French style pastries and croissants. The cosy bar was a pleasure and no need for signing here - the staff knew who we were! Sadly the roof top restaurant was closed when we were there which was a great pity. We shall just have to return. Location is fabulous, jus a few steps from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. All in all, a first class place with seamless service and a lovely intimate atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the lobby...”
Reviews.Author: bluehorizen
Reviews.Content: The lobby is magnificent: giant portraits hung on wood paneled walls and Persian carpets. However, our room was depressing. It had no light, no view (a building was 3 feet away outside our windows), the rug was wall to wall with a giant stain at the entrance, no bed side table, nowhere to set a cup of coffee in the a.m. The concierge had to go to "google" if I had any of the questions about restaurants. We were greeted by a late night lurch with about as much personality as a corpse. It has a sweet little fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Non-Touristy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seabreezer
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at Hotel Raphael. We stayed in a Junior Suite with an adjoining room for our teenage son. They were both very spacious with wonderful bathrooms and amenities. Service was exemplary, room service was flawless and the concierge staff was as good as any 5 star hotel or resort. The staff is very professional and welcoming. Some posters feel the hotel needs renovation but the bedding and bathrooms were newly refurbished and perhaps the antique furnishings are a turn-off for some but this is Paris after-all and the ambiance of the decor is perfect IMHO. It was certainly clean and classically decorated and didn't seem to need any renovation as far as I could tell. The restaurant was excellent for breakfast and the rooftop terrace had a spectacular view with the only drawback being e22 for a cocktail! The neighborhood is not in a tourist center but rather a very elegant upper class part of the city with lovely streets for shopping and some very authentic brasseries, bistros and restaurants. Every restaurant that we were referred to had a mostly french clientele and usually french-only menus. The big plus is the Avenue Kleber Metro station right out the front door of the hotel. Paris has the best subway system in the world (when there's not a strike happening!) and there is never a need to use taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MYLeeHeidi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last weekend and have a wonderful memory. We travel in Paris from time to time, stayed in many four stars and five stars hotels in Paris before, Hotel Raphael Paris is flawless. We would like to say thank you to all the staffs we met during our stay who were so friendly and so helpful. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering to the max”
Reviews.Author: katasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before a barge trip through Burgundy, and were charmed to be upgraded to a Junior Suite from the booked deluxe room. We were met with a lovely plate of fruit and pastries, and instant luggage delivery. The concierge, Yannick Tonnellier, could not have been more helpful. The rest of the trip was wonderful as well, but we were sorry to leave the hotel after only one night. It is true, as some other reviewers have mentioned, that not much is going on in that part of town, and it is a bit of a hike to dining/shopping establishments, but that was as we liked it. The Metro is very convenient, with access to multiple lines very close. Lovely place, and we look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Question”
Reviews.Author: izf1971
Reviews.Content: Love this Hotel. We are planning to stay at Raphael Hotel again in August 2010. Does anyone know if construction of the next building will be done? Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Raphael Unless You Want to Live in a Construction Zone!!”
Reviews.Author: N0rthTexasTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raphael for two weeks during mid-march 2010. The Hotel has been maintained very nicely and the service and staff are exceptional -- what you would expect from a very good four star hotel. HOWEVER, the 5 story building next door to the Hotel is currently being totall rebuilt and the NOISE from this construction zone is ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. Construction noise begins at approximately 5:30 AM each morning and lasts until late afternoon six days each week. The construction workers seem to work diligently to make the most noise possible -- hydraulic jack hammers pound all day long -- and construction debris (concrete and steel) is continuously dumped into dumpsters at ground level. The noise and vibrations reverberate throughout the entire Hotel. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND AVOIDING THIS HOTEL until the building construction is complete -- my guess is one year or more -- the building being rebuilt is a large 5 story building. Note: I have stayed at numerous hotels around the world while they were under-going construction or remodeling -- but I have never experienced anything like the NOISE at the Hotel Raphael. BEWARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: stevenhb
Reviews.Content: We loved the Terrasse on top oft he Building. Big Rooms (by Paris standards). Rooms are a little bit out-dated, but still very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, huge rooms, amazing views and lovely, quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: loveluxuryholidays_9
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in the Raphael in September 2009, I’m a bit late writing this review, but since my partner and I are still raving about what a lovely hotel this is it I thought it was time I wrote one. This is a beautiful hotel for a romantic trip, we had a Boudoire room and it was absolutely huge with a lovely dressing room and a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The breakfast room is beautiful and you really do feel like you are in a palace, and the food at breakfast was excellent - they bring out such a large selection of croissants and pastries. The service was incredibly polite, there was a query about some extra drinks on our bill and the hotel removed them instantly. Yes the street surrounding the hotel is quiet- as some other people have commented but we liked that. We like the fact that you could very easily walk to many of the major sites in Paris very quickly and then get back to your quiet hotel and not get kept awake at night by tourists in the street. As we went in the winter and the weather had been pretty horrible leading up to our weekend the roof terrace restaurant was closed, but we managed to have a look up there and it was beautiful- gives us a good excuse to return to the Raphael in the summer I suppose ;)

Reviews.Title: “Ornate and Comfortable, Top-Notch Conciege Service, Sterile Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mcal3K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Raphael for a week in November. We were traveling with another couple whose timeshare entitled them to a two-bedroom suite. The entire hotel was beautiful and very authentically ornate, with gorgeous wood floors and bannisters, plaster decorative mouldings, murals, etc. The mattress was new and firm and the bathroom large, including a full size tub and separate stall shower. Our package included breakfast, which was delivered to our room each day and included breads, yogurt, eggs, and fruit. Another plus was that the Kleber Metro stop was literally right out the front door. Our friends made good use of the EXCELLENT concierge service, which helped them arrange everything from dinner reservations to a private tour of Reims/Epernay. They were also willing and able to assist with a side trip to Normandy if we had decided to pursue that option. The concierge seemed to be available and attentive at all hours, even late into the evening. The only criticism I will make of the hotel services, which in all other ways were excellent, was that there was no free internet services in the rooms. There was a cumbersome process of using extremely long passwords and codes and international cell phone #s in order to PURCHASE internet service. This was a minor inconvenience to me, as I only wanted to use the internet briefly each evening for personal communication, but I imagine a business traveler would be quite hampered by running out of minutes, needing to enter new time-sensitive codes, etc. The hotel needs to re-evaluate this and change it. The only other "criticism" is that this area of the 16th is pretty "dead." It's a good thing that the room service breakfast was so good because there was no option to walk to a neighborhood cafe, bakery, etc. We wanted to grab a quick bite in the neighborhood on the first night we got there, and actually had a hard time finding a place. The options were very limited. Not like the "Paris" that I was used to in the other places in which I've stayed. Good thing the Metro is so near because you NEED to get somewhere from there in order to see any signs of life. On our last night there, we did find some excellent pizza about 8 blocks away. But the streets were deserted. So I guess I'm saying that I adored the hotel itself (aside form the poor internet access), but I see the location as being too isolated. Although I was just a brief walk away from the Arc de Triomphe or a short metro ride from anywhere I wanted to be, the neighborhood wasn't for me. I want to step out my front door and BE somewhere in PARIS. For the price that the Raphael must have been (and I was lucky to be a guest of our generous friends), I'm sure we could have combined comfort and location MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: pamsrollz
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning for our 6 night stay, and were happy to be able to check right into our suite. The hotel staff could not have been more professional and helpful. On the second day in Paris the metro machine ate our 5 day pass, and the concierge did everything possible, even accompanied me to the subway ticket seller to try to get our pass back. To no avail, but the effort was amazing. The breakfast buffet was included in our package, and was delicious, fresh, and included an excellent assortment of fruit, breads, yoghurts, eggs, cheese and meats. The fresh squeezed juice was fantastic, with great coffee service. We had dinner at the hotel one night, very professional service, and top notch food preparation. Our bathroom was large, clean, bright, and we loved the towel warmer. The bed was comfortable, but I struggled a bit with finding just the right pillow. The closet space is enough for a family of 6, fantastic. The housekeeping staff was exceptional. Everything was cleaned perfectly, we asked for turn down once, and then received it each night. The location is great as the metro is right out the front door. A wonderful dinner restaurant to try that's only a 10 minute walk down Kleber is Passiflore. Otherwise most great restaurants are an easy metro ride away. The only downside was that we had to pay for internet service. If you like a small old world, quiet, elegant hotel with big time silk draperies and comfort, you will love the Raphael.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jeansãopaulo
Reviews.Content: After traveling with my family for 13 days in France my husband and I had reservations at this hotel not expecting much due to mixed reviews ,.First we were given an upgrade to a huge room which is always a pleasure ,tickets for salle pleyell not available through internet were provided through the helpful staff but what really really confirmed that this hotel has the best concierge in Paris was when I lost my flight Monsieur Lionel the head concierge very efficiently dwelt with the situation in such a professional way that even if I panicked at first he almost made me laugh about the whole thing.Thank you all at hotel Raphel for having such wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better....”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raphael is a throwback to a time when smaller "boutique" hotels were housed in old palaces in city centers, with ornate rooms, high ceilings, large marble bathrooms with towel warmers, and staff which is both hospitable and knowledgeable. This hotel is all that, and more... It's located steps from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. It has one of the best Concierge desks in Paris, able to get a table in a Michelin three-star restaurant on short notice, or suggest a hideaway matching exactly what one's heart desires. It has a bar which is capable to make an outstanding cocktail drink to one's exact specifications, and it has a large terrace (and Summer restaurant), on top of the building, worth by itself a stay at the hotel - best view in Paris. The "Salle A Manger" is an excellent restaurant, worth a dinner, even though the service is iffy. The uneveness of the service is what one has to accept at this hotel: the bell boys/voiturier are great, the Front desk outstanding, the room service not good (breakfast delivered twice to the wrong room with no follow up), cleaning staff uneven (weekend better than weekdays), etc.. The worst part, in the short run (i.e. until Spring '10), is that immediately next to the hotel there is a large building being renovated. That means that all of the rooms/suites facing that building (e.g. 104, 204, 304, etc.) will have substantial construction noise all day long, especially around 8:00 a.m.. Thus, one of the beauties of Avenue Kleber's location (the quiet of a high-end residential area), is gone.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliza6
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Raphael before joining a barge cruise in Burgundy. Our flight arrived early so we were at the Raphael at 8:30 am and our room was not ready. Although check-in time is not until noon, they provided another guest room as a "waiting room" so we could rest and freshen up until our room was available. Our room was very large with a huge adjoining bathroom, and huge closets (dating back to the time when guests brought ball gowns and hats). The decor was lovely. The hotel provided a beautiful "welcome" tray of fresh fruit. Complimentary Complimentary breakfast buffet had several choices, although the scrambled eggs were made with so much butter and cream we couldn't eat them. The staff was very helpful.and courteous, everyone spoke English and French. The Concierge, Lionel, went above and beyond to assist us. When we made hotel reservations in April we emailed the Concierge asking that he arrange for luncheon reservations at the Jules Verne in the Eiffel Tower. Although we had been told that Jules Verne reservations were very difficult to obtain, the Concierge secured the reservations-- at a window table. The Concierge also sells Museum Passes and tickets to the L'Open double decker bus tours. The bus stop and the Metro stop are conveniently located right outside the hotel doors. Lionel also gave us great directions for our trip to Versailles. The Raphael location is very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees, and about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel bar is cozy, and it seems that many local professionals frequent the bar. Our only negative experience was the restaurant on the roof that has a wonderful view of Paris. We were hoping for a light dinner, and the only option was a fixed price menu for 90 euros per person. We settled for room service. Otherwise, the Raphael is agreat hotel and we will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: UpprNWTravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Hotel Raphael in early July 2009 and couldn't have loved it more. The hotel is outstanding from top to bottom. From the room decor to the service professionals to the restaurant to the attention to detail, it's a first rate hotel. The staff even hosted a 4th of July party for the Americans staying in the hotel. The hotel's location is great; there's a metro stop right outside the hotel. The Champs Elysees and l'Arc de Triomphe are just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant ambiance, convenient but quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: barthic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last weekend of April in a 2 bedroom corner suite. The staff were superb from the moment we arrived. The decor and appointments of the hotel are classically adorned and luxurious at every turn. Every detail is a delightful feast for the eyes and no comfort is overlooked here. (Ladies be warned: bring your own after-shampoo hair conditioner. None of the hotels we stayed at during our 2 weeks in France provided any...including this one!) The dining room and the bar are lovely and full of character, but it only took one visit to each to realize that, EVEN FOR PARIS, the prices for food and cocktails were simply astronomical and we quickly learned about less expensive local restaurants. Fortunately, our rate included breakfast each morning and it was exquisitely presented, fresh, fast and served by extraordinarily pleasant wait staff. So we had no complaints about the superb quality of the dining here just the outrageous cost. Our rooms were beautiful with delightful views from the tiny balconies. Location is only 3 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe & Champs-Elysees and mere steps to the underground station from this hotel's front door. For us the quiet surroundings of the locale were perfect. Others have complained the immediate neighborhood was "not where the action is", so bear that in mind. At the end of a busy & touristy day it was a welcome retreat from noise and battling opposing foot traffic. We loved it and will return. Concierge were all very helpful and pleasant and the entire staff were welcoming and consistently made us feel at home. Congratulations to everyone at Hotel Raphael!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: howdyweiss47 Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: We successfully bid on auction for the 6 night package at the Hotel Raphael in Paris. Our suite was beautifully furnished with antiques, dramatic curtains, high ceilings with ornate moldings: it was like staying at Versailles with Louis XIV! The closet in our room was larger than the entire room at some other hotels in Paris. The rooftop patio had a panoramic view of the city including the Eiffel Tower. The impeccable service in the restaurant was matched by the quality of the food. The location was quite convenient: 2 blocks from the Arch d'Triumphe and the Champs d'Elysee - the Kleber metro stop was literally 50 feet from the hotel entrance. The hotel is frequented by international diplomats and heads of state (one of whom visited while we were there). We had some "special needs", and the hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate us without any fuss or complaint: this hotel deserves their 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Wes Andersons Hotel Chevlier is this spot!”
Reviews.Author: modvulgar
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 5 star hotel and 5 star price! We shelled out for the romance package and although its the same as a months rent for me its TOTALLY WORTH EVERY PENNY!! You can see this hotel in the short film by wes andersons hotel chevlier, its awesome on film and more impressive in person. The staff went above and beyond for us, one friend got her monthly visitor and they ran tampons up to the room. We asked them to contact the train company thames to see if they could get us on an earlier train back to amsterdamn and they stayed on the phone with them for HOURS for us untill the customer svc for thames closed!!. Also they brought us up the box of DVD's they have, we wanted the new marie antonnette or wes andersons darjelling limited, they agreed they should purchase both soon as they only had mostly action films. The location couldnt be more perfect. Champes de Elysse need I say more? Shopping, best food, metro right out the front door, the Arch and the Tower are able to be seen from the roof top terrace reasturant AND within walking distance!! If i can afford it again I WILL return. There is a reason its included in the 100 most luxiourious hotels in the world!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: ParisCharlie
Reviews.Content: superb hotel. Our room was a deluxe and was particularly large and so nice with its typical parisian decoration and furniture. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very convenient. The English Bar is very nice for a drink before dinner. Breakfast was amazingly good. The fitness room is very well provided and has a (very) small hammam and a small sauna. It is just 2 minutes walking from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysées. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at the Raphael”
Reviews.Author: fuzeboxny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raphael the second week of November for three nights to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The room was spacious, luxurious and beautifully decorated. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable and willing to help with any questions. The concierge obtained a lovely boquet of sunflowers for our room upon our arrival and assisted with transfers to and from the airport as well as with museum passes. The room was as depicted on the web site (photo attached). It was a bit on the chilly side so the terrace was closed for dining, but accessible for a lovely view of the Arc du Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is walking distance to the Champs d'Elysee and the metro (though we used the Charles de Gaule stop instead of the Kleber stop). It is about a 15 minute walk to the Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower. The street is a bit on the quite side, so if one is looking for more night life nearby a different location may be more suitable. For us, we could not have asked for a better place to stay. The complimentary breakfast was outstanding with fresh croissants and excellent freshly squeezed orange juice. Our thanks to Yannick for his help and courtesies. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is really good, room was nice and large (in Parisian standards) and a welcome basket of fruits were waiting. Still it lacked something in the atmosphere. One night concierge gave a good (local) restaurant recommendation but totally wrong walking instructions! Next time I will try one of the Grand hotels (George V, Le Meurice etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and the best part of the trip...”
Reviews.Author: ub42
Reviews.Content: Traveling often and chosing the hotels carefully, this one is a real gem. A clear "Leading small hotel of the world". Everything was easy and beautiful. Check in. Breakfast. Location. Service. AAA+ and not much more to add. Just the perfect place to find peace and good service after a busy day in town.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh!”
Reviews.Author: whatuk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend decided to stay here on our train journey to marrakech. we stayed one night in paris, and chose this hotel because it appears in the daarjelling limited, and because it looked VERY nice. the hotel is beautiful, with antique furniture, and paintings. the staff did seem a little perplexed at us, in our shorts and rucksacks, but i 'spose they don't see too many people like that staying there. we had the cheapest room, which was nice, but you could tell it was the cheapest room in a very expensive hotel. also the roof terrace was closed for 2 days while we were there, which was annoying, as this was a real plus point of this hotel for me. everyone spoke good english, which was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alza1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! The lobby is kind of small and stuffy, but the gracious staff more than made up for it. There is an amazing cafe on the roof with incredible views of the city. The decor was spectacular, with beautiful antique furniture. The bathrooms were also very nice, very large and comfortable. We had a two room suite with two full baths, and it also had a very nice vanity with a huge mirror and great lighting for doing makeup. The location was great, literally right in the heart of a lot of luxury shopping. The area was very safe, also. My sister and I walked a couple blocks around the hotel well past midnight and still felt completely secure. All in all, staying at this hotel was an amazing experience and I would love to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rzzoom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raphael is a truly beautiful hotel,operated with charm and efficiency and with the best concierge team of any I have encountered in Paris de luxe hotels. This hotel manages to be luxurious but homely at the same time. The restaurant is excellent,the bar small but lively and popular and the whole ambience is enjoyable and thankfully completely devoid of the snobbery and self congratulatory manner of other top Paris hotels. I understand this hotel is privately owned and it shows.The attention to detail,the personal service and the feeling of being an individual and not part of a production line. Although the hotel is located on a main Avenue,Kleber,the hotel is set back and is quiet. The rooms are superbly furnished and the junior suite that we had was magnificent..the word "junior" being amusing as these suites are larger than many others I have stayed in. All in all,a great hotel. Sometimes I wonder at the feedbacks that hotels get on these websites and generally I see those for the Raphael are good. It is hard to see how anyone could be negative about the Raphael..everythings a matter of opinion but there is nothing ambiguous to say about this hotel.It is,quite simply,one of the top 3 in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and lots of room”
Reviews.Author: FS_Junkie_with_kids
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Hotel Raphael from Dec 26-27, 2007. The location was great, very convenient to the side view of the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Elysees and Avenue Victor Hugo. We walked to the Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower with kids ages 6 & 8. The service from the staff even prior to arrival was 5 star. They made excellent recommendations for dinner reservations, tours, and sight-seeing. They recommended a deluxe junior suite with two rollaway beds for the children which were fine. The staff was always prompt in their e-mail correspondence and helpful. Once there, from the bellman (Larry in particular was wonderfully friendly and helpful saving us the cab fare to the Eiffel Tower) to the reception desk to the concierge and restaurant, everyone provided top notch service. The hotel is a boutique hotel designed for longer stays so there is plenty of room to stretch out and unpack.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- great service”
Reviews.Author: fruff
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Raphael. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. We arrived early in the morning (8:00a.m.) and tried to check in but there were no rooms available. We had reserved a Junior suite with an alcove. The front desk suggested that we go out for breakfast and and come back about 1:00 p.m. but at 10:30 they called our cell phone and told us that our room was ready. Much to our surprise, they upgraded us to a larger, beautiful suite. The hotel is in a perfect location. It seemed that it would cost about 10 euros to go anywhere in a taxi. The concierge is very helpful. Every suggestion they made for dinner was excellent. I agree with the previous reviewer about the drinks. We walked out of the bar because of the cost of the drinks. Nineteen euros for a vodka tonic!!!!! We could not justify paying that. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: williamc
Reviews.Content: Found the Raphael staff to be charming and very polite and helpful. The hotel is well located being vertually on top of the Arc de triumph. The rooms were lovely, well sized pretty decoration and the bathroom was fabulous. It was a resplendant hotel at every level. The only negative comment relates to the price of drinks at the bar, as these were very expensive. Overall we had a great stay, were able to wander around Paris with ease from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful bed”
Reviews.Author: pjatravel
Reviews.Content: Definitely in the "leading hotels of the world" category. Didn't get to partake of all on offer, but was pleased to be close to the Arche De Triomphe and Champs Ellysees. Wish I had more time for the breakfast (looked good), but the wonderful bed sucked me under and I had a good nights sleep. Perfect location for a business trip and different than my experiences out in the no mans land of La Defence.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast disaster”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: Compared with the other palace hotels in Paris, the most traditional is the Raphael (even more so than the Bristol): original interior, old-fashioned service, not at all corporate or hip, like a luxurious private mansion. The room (junior suite) was very large by any standard with a luxurious bathroom (well renovated). For 600€ per night, the room was a little worn, though, and some upgrading is necessary: more comfortable furniture, flat screen TV, hifi, etc. The reason I am rating the hotel three stars is the breakfast: 36€ for a low-quality and very limited buffet! The Raphaël has a very good chef for lunch and dinner, and they should put him in charge of the first meal of the day. For this reason, I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shendrix
Reviews.Content: it was very passable, nothing too over the top, about what I expected in this price range. Staff was fine, bathroom amenties of good quality, linens of good quality, just nothing extra for 350 euros/ night. Breakfast is not included and is 30 euros and looked okay but for that kind of money I would step outside the hotel and find another spot for a coffee and pastry for around 4-5 euros. Very business oriented type clientile. Why no 5 star review? The TV's suck. At this price I expect a flat screen and free interenet. Good ocation right by the Arc. Walking distance to Champs and Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel Raphael”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Raphael for three nights in March 2006 with my girlfriend. We were two females travelign alone and th lcaotion can't be beat. the hotel is within walking distance to the Eifel Towe, Arc de Triomphe, and Champs de Elysees. We ordered room service and found the choices to be somewhat limiting, but the hotel rooms were very nice. We had a one bedrooom suite and found the separate area to be very good for two women who sometimes want their own space. The cocierge was also very helpful and courteous. For the price would probably try another hotel next time, but did enjoy this hotel. We ate at the hotel one night for dinner and found the food to be excellent. The only complaint I have about the hotel is that the gym facilities are very small and didn't provide enough equipment for a full workout. But due to the excellent locaiton I made it up by walking everywhere. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but don't ask the concierge for advice”
Reviews.Author: 300KperYear
Reviews.Content: The Raphael is nice boutique hotel with quite a bit of character. My wife and stayed there for Bastille Day and actually enjoyed it. First of all, they upgraded us to a two room suite with both rooms the size of a normal Four Seasons Hotel. The hotel is older, but is clean and has the modern amenities. Our bedroom had french doors seperating it from the sitting area. The bed was very comfortable which is more than I can say for the other furniture in the room. The couch was ornate, but was small and hard as a rock. The shower was tiny, but did have the mutliple jets (one of the self-contained units). If you are overweight, I am not sure you could even use it. The bathtub was very beautiful (antique free-standing with brass feet). Its a bit of a hike from the Louvre and about the same distance from l'Orsay, but is very close to Champps Elyesee. It is very quiet which we enjoyed (even on Bastille Day). Its fairly close the Tower. So the part I did not like was their concierge. Nice enough people, but terrible in recommendations. They recommended a couple of "Jazz" clubs for us to check out. We visited the first one, its was the size of a small basement and full of smoke (most clubs in Paris are), but the problem was that everyone there was in their early 70's or late 60's. Which would be ok, if we weren't in our early 30s. The second recommendation (which we stopped by only out of shear curiousity) was supposedly the "happening" place where we could use his card to get in. I am glad we had it as there wsa not a doorman or anyone else there for that matter. I think there were about 10 people in the entire bar and there was not a band. Needless to say we ended up going the bar at the Plaza Athenee, which is definitely a place to see and be seen (several celebs there when we went). Its worth seeing and the staff was actually fairly friendly. I could give another paragraph on their restaurant recommendations, which were actually worse than the clubs. They will "encourage" you to eat in the roof top restaurant and its actually not bad. It does have a nice view and is the like dinning in a garden in the middle of the city. The tables are seperated by hedges & assorted plants. A bit pricey, but compared to other places its not outrageous. All in all, its nice hotel. There are definitely better the Four Seasons was truly amazing (go there for high tea), the Plaza Athenee & the Crillion, but then again you are not spending $1000 a night either. For what you spend, its a nice hotel with large rooms that have character.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the Raphael”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for the Raphael as it looked beautiful on the website and the staff we spoke to prior to the reservation were very helpful. When we arrived, we were shown to a suite that was very dark, with wrinkled, old carpet and sagging beds. The furniture was uncomfortable and too dainty to actually sit upon. The small and ancient television in the salon was placed on a side table that looked like it was taken from someone's basement. The only redeeming feature was the large and beautiful bathroom - very French, and completely renovated but we could not bear the thought of staying in the room for 4 nights. We requested another suite which was brighter and had a nice bathroom but the the salon and bedroom were still a little shabby; the doors to the cupboards stuck, the light switches had a mind of their own and on the last night, a fuse blew when we turned on a light in the sitting room. The art in the rooms and public areas was impressive but did not make up for the dated and shabby decor in general. While some people may view the decor as charming, I do not feel that this hotel is first class or luxurious - perhaps it was 30 years ago. It was very expensive and neither rooms nor the service merited the price. We did visit the Roof Restaurant and the view and the atmosphere were magical. Unfortunately, the food was poor and not what we expected for the price - two main courses had to be returned and one was essentially inedible even after the 2nd try yet we recieved no apology and were charged full price for all of the meals. We left a message for the concierge and/or manager but did not receive a telephone call from either. However, regardless of the mediocre/poor food, the Roof was worth the visit because of the view. We would have liked to have visited the Roof bar but on 2 of the 4 nights we were there, the entire Roof area was closed for a private party. We will not return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the quality of the room they gave us. Not only was there water stains in several locations of the carpeting, the a/c unit leaked profusely thru the room, the television had to be replaced, and the complimentary fruit they left in our room had rotten items. The decor was old and not just in the historic sense, and my companion and I both experienced extreme "itching" on our legs both days at this hotel. We had to either assume we were both allergic to their detergent or possible bed bugs. We never had this issue at any other hotel prior nor any after. We stopped into the bar after dinner and although there were at least 6 others sitting, there was not a bar tender present until someone finally complained to the concierge upon which the hotel manager stepped in. My next experience was while I was frantically trying to use the internet to change my flights after the London bombings. There was a lady using the internet for hours to check her email. After discussing how much longer she would be, I found she wasn't even a guest at the hotel! She walked in off the street and needed to use a computer. On a postive note, the concierge went above and beyond to help in any way possible during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Raphael: Our Favorite Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn
Reviews.Content: We were there May 24-30, 2005. Every staff member speaks fluent English and none could have provided more impeccable service. They treated us not only with respect, but like welcome family members. I arranged the trip through an auction on LuxuryLink and the value was unbelievable; I recommend it without reservation. We received a huge, lovely bouquet of flowers and a sumptuous basket of fruit when we arrived. Our suite (the Duplex - you can see it on their website) was impeccably decorated in Louis XV style and included a spiral staircase to a study area and a balcony from which we could see the Arc de Triomphe, Sacre Coeur, Champs Elysee and (standing on a chair), the Eiffel Tower, all while surrounded by jasmine, roses and more in the little garden area. Sunrise and sunset were both staggering. The breakfast could be taken in a lovely dining room from a buffet or in our own room - either way, there was a wide variety of delicious breakfast food and tons of coffee with hot milk in silver pitchers. Dinner was equally delicious and also very graciously served. The metro station Kleber and a taxi stand were literally right outside the door. The bathroom was luxurious - my favorite soaps, plus huge, thick towels and terry robes and slippers in a bathroom that felt like an Italian tile work of art; a fabulous multi-headed shower plus a huge tub, bidet, toilet and generous sink, too. The furniture and bed were covered in fine silk and the furnishings were exquisite. Reservations were made seamlessly and all manner of confusions were straighted out by the concierge staff. We felt like royalty!! Perfect place for a romance of the century!!
